intro: Stenomesson macleanicum, commonly known as the Maclean's sedge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, triangular leaves. It produces spikes of tiny, greenish-white flowers, which are typically clustered at the ends of the stems. Stenomesson macleanicum is often found in moist, sandy soils in coastal and inland regions of its native habitat.
